items.title: Free for Dev
items.content_text:
### Security and PKI

*   [aikido.dev](https://www.aikido.dev) â€” All-in-one appsec platform covering SCA, SAST, CSPM, DAST, Secrets, IaC, Malware, Container scanning, EOL,... Free plan includes two users, scanning of 10 repos, 1 cloud, 2 containers & 1 domain.

items.title: Awesome Creative Coding
items.content_text:
### Sound Programming Languages

*   [Orca](https://100r.co/site/orca.html) - Live coding environment to quickly create procedural sequencers.
items.content_html:
Sound Programming Languages

  • Orca - Live coding environment to quickly create procedural sequencers.

items.title: Awesome Game Engine Dev
items.content_text:
### Game Engines / Commercial

*   ğŸ’¸ [PlayCanvas](https://playcanvas.com) - Popular (*Flappy Bird*) WebGL game engine. \[[Awesome (â­301)](https://github.com/playcanvas/awesome-playcanvas#readme) | [GitHub (â­10k)](https://github.com/playcanvas/engine)]

### Game Engines / Specialty

*   ğŸ’¸ [DopeFish](https://lemontoast-games.itch.io/dopefish) - *Doom* / *Heretic* map loading system for *GameMaker*.

### Learning / Computer Graphics

*   Graphics API: Mantle
    *   ğŸ“š [Mantle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mantle_\(API\)) - Developed by *AMD* as an alternative to Direct3D and OpenGL.
*   Graphics API: Metal
    *   ğŸŒ [Metal](https://developer.apple.com/metal/) - API for developing 3D apps on *Apple* platforms. \[[Samples](https://developer.apple.com/metal/sample-code/)]
    *   ğŸ“š [Metal Tutorial](https://www.raywenderlich.com/7475-metal-tutorial-getting-started) - Learn how to get started with Metal at *RayWenderlich.com*.
*   Graphics API: WebGPU
    *   ğŸŒ [Dawn](https://dawn.googlesource.com/dawn) - Open source, cross-platform implementation of the WebGPU standard, by *Google*.
    *   ğŸŒ [WebGPU (â­5.1k)](https://github.com/gpuweb/gpuweb/wiki/Implementation-Status) - Next generation web 3D graphics API. \[[GitHub (â­5.1k)](https://github.com/gpuweb/gpuweb)]
    *   ğŸŒ [WebGPU Demos](https://webkit.org/demos/webgpu/) - Collection of simple WebGPU examples by *Apple*.

### Libraries / C

*   C: Graphics - 3D
    *   ğŸ‰ [Sokol Gfx (â­8.4k)](https://github.com/floooh/sokol/blob/master/sokol_gfx.h) - Cross-platform, single-file graphics. \[[Examples](https://floooh.github.io/sokol-html5/)]
    *   ğŸ‰ [Sokol Graphics Painter (â­517)](https://github.com/edubart/sokol_gp) - 2D graphics painter implemented with *Sokol*.
*   C: Input
    *   ğŸ‰ [libGamepad (â­24)](https://github.com/mtwilliams/libgamepad) - Cross-platform library for gamepad input.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Sokol Gamepad (â­8.4k)](https://github.com/floooh/sokol/pull/393/commits/26a9da9dafd4adb22a1ace0de0d2569da31ae427) - Branch with addon support for gamepads in *Sokol*.
*   C: Math
    *   ğŸ‰ [Cglm (â­2.6k)](https://github.com/recp/cglm) - Highly optimized OpenGL math.
    *   â­ [Handmade Math (â­1.4k)](https://github.com/HandmadeMath/Handmade-Math) ğŸ”¥ - Simple, public domain math library for games and computer graphics.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Kazmath (â­531)](https://github.com/Kazade/kazmath) - Math library targeted at games.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Raymath (â­27k)](https://github.com/raysan5/raylib/blob/master/src/raymath.h) - Math library included in the *RayLib* game framework.

### Libraries / C++

*   C++: File System
    *   ğŸ‰ [Imgui-Filebrowser (â­755)](https://github.com/AirGuanZ/imgui-filebrowser) - Header-only file browser implementation for *Dear ImGui* in C++17.
*   C++: Game Engine w/Editor
    *   ğŸ‰ [AnKi 3D Engine (â­1.5k)](https://github.com/godlikepanos/anki-3d-engine) - Vulkan backend, modern renderer, scripting, physics and more.
    *   ğŸ”’ [Crown Engine (â­2.2k)](https://github.com/crownengine/crown) - Data-driven 3D and 2D game engine.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Crystal Engine (â­190)](https://github.com/neelmewada/CrystalEngine) - Vulkan backend with PBR and styled GUI (*CrystalWidgets*).
    *   ğŸ‰ [Drop Creator (â­7)](https://github.com/scidian/drop) - No code, 2.5D game engine built with *Qt*, OpenGL and *Chipmunk Physics*.
    *   ğŸ”’ [Enigma (â­357)](https://github.com/enigma-dev/enigma-dev) - GameMaker compatible 2D engine.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Esoterica Engine (â­984)](https://github.com/BobbyAnguelov/Esoterica) - High-performance game engine with editor and AAA quality animation graph.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Ethereal Engine (â­711)](https://github.com/ir-engine/etherealengine-archive) - Cross-platform game engine and editor.
    *   ğŸ‰ [ezEngine (â­1.7k)](https://github.com/ezEngine/ezEngine) - Game engine in active development.
    *   ğŸ‰ [FIFE (â­565)](https://github.com/fifengine/fifengine) - Multi-platform isometric game engine.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Irrlicht](https://sourceforge.net/projects/irrlicht/) - Cross-platform 3D engine worked on for nearly 2 decades. \[[Website](https://irrlicht.sourceforge.io/)]
    *   ğŸ‰ [Limon Engine (â­654)](https://github.com/enginmanap/limonEngine) - 3D FPS game engine with full dynamic lighting and shadows.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Lina Engine (â­867)](https://github.com/inanevin/LinaEngine) - Modular game engine, aimed to develop 3D desktop games.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Lumos (â­1.4k)](https://github.com/jmorton06/Lumos) - Cross-platform 2D/3D game engine, supports both OpenGL and Vulkan.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Lumix Engine (â­3.6k)](https://github.com/nem0/LumixEngine) - A 3D game engine with *Dear ImGui* based editor.
    *   ğŸ‰ [MxEngine (â­1.2k)](https://github.com/asc-community/MxEngine) - Modern-C++ general-purpose 3D game engine.
    *   ğŸ”’ [neoGFX (â­560)](https://github.com/i42output/neogfx) - Cross-platform app and game engine.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Ã–bEngine (â­840)](https://github.com/ObEngine/ObEngine) - 2D engine with Lua scripting built with *SFML*.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Overload (â­2.3k)](https://github.com/adriengivry/Overload) - Well documented 3D game engine inspired by industry standards.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Razix Engine (â­492)](https://github.com/Pikachuxxxx/Razix) - High-performance research engine for production pipeline.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Rootex (â­225)](https://github.com/sdslabs/rootex) - Advanced C++ 3D game engine powering an in-production game.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Skylicht (â­730)](https://github.com/skylicht-lab/skylicht-engine) - Upgraded features including audio, physics and particles. Built on *Irrlicht*.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Spartan Engine (â­2.5k)](https://github.com/PanosK92/SpartanEngine) - Emphasis on quality and performance.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Torque 3D (â­3.4k)](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D) - High-performance 3D engine built on *The Forge*.
    *   ğŸ”’ [UPBGE (â­1.6k)](https://github.com/UPBGE/upbge) - Blender game engine, originally forked from *Blender*.
*   C++: Graphics - 2D
    *   ğŸ‰ [Blend2D (â­1.8k)](https://github.com/blend2d/blend2d) - High-performance 2D vector graphics engine. \[[Website](https://blend2d.com/)]
    *   ğŸ‰ [C++ Bitmap Library (â­175)](https://github.com/ArashPartow/bitmap) - Featured bitmap loading and manipulation library.
    *   ğŸ‰ [QNanoPainter (â­422)](https://github.com/QUItCoding/qnanopainter) - OpenGL accelerated vector drawing library for *Qt*, powered by *NanoVG*.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Skia (â­9.9k)](https://github.com/google/skia) - Complete 2D graphics library used in Chrome by *Google*. \[[Website](https://skia.org)]
    *   ğŸ‰ [vg-renderer (â­576)](https://github.com/jdryg/vg-renderer) - 2D vector graphics renderer for *Bgfx*, based on ideas from *NanoVG*.
*   C++: Input
    *   ğŸ‰ [Gainput (â­875)](https://github.com/jkuhlmann/gainput) - Easy to use input library.
    *   ğŸ‰ [OIS (â­266)](https://github.com/wgois/OIS) - Object-oriented input system. Compatiable with many operating systems.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Oryol Input (â­2k)](https://github.com/floooh/oryol/tree/043683dcb3181beb64ae1c85ea76e4a4eb71c124/code/Modules/Input) - Input module from the *Oryol* game framework.
*   C++: Libraries
    *   ğŸ‰ [Boost Libraries](https://github.com/boostorg) - Wide range of C++ libraries, many end up as part of the STL. \[[Website](https://www.boost.org)]
    *   ğŸ“š [Gamedev Libraries (â­1.6k)](https://github.com/raizam/gamedev_libraries) - Collection of open source C/C++ libraries for game development.
    *   ğŸ“š [Inqlude](https://inqlude.org) - List of libraries for developers of *Qt*-based apps.
    *   ğŸ“š [List of Open Source C++ Libraries](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/links/libs) - Comprehensive list of open source C++ libraries.
    *   ğŸ“š [NVIDIA GameWorks](https://github.com/NVIDIAGameWorks) - *NVIDIA* technologies for game & app developers.

### Libraries / C#

*   C#: Cross-Platform
    *   ğŸŒ [Blazor (â­37k)](https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore/blob/main/src/Components/README.md) - C# to JavaScript (as WebAssembly) technology by *Microsoft*. \[[Website](\(https://dotnet.microsoft.com/en-us/apps/aspnet/web-apps/blazor\))]
    *   ğŸ‰ [Mono (â­11k)](https://github.com/mono/mono) - Open source implementation of *Microsoft*'s .NET Framework.
*   C#: Entity Component System
    *   ğŸ‰ [Arch (â­1.3k)](https://github.com/genaray/Arch) - High-performance ECS with optional multithreading.
    *   ğŸ‰ [DefaultEcs (â­707)](https://github.com/Doraku/DefaultEcs) - ECS framework designed for game development.
    *   ğŸ”’ [Friflo.Engine.ECS (â­174)](https://github.com/friflo/Friflo.Json.Fliox/blob/main/Engine/README.md) - Archetype based ECS with focus on performance, cache locality and DX.
    *   ğŸ‰ [LeoECS (â­199)](https://github.com/Leopotam/ecs) - ECS framework powered by C# with optional integration to *Unity*.
*   C#: Geometry
    *   ğŸ‰ [DotRecast (â­722)](https://github.com/ikpil/DotRecast) - A port of *Recast & Detour*, navigation mesh toolset for games, Unity3D, servers, C#.

### Libraries / Go

*   ğŸŒ [Go](https://go.dev/) - Statically typed, compiled programming language designed at *Google*. \[[GitHub](https://github.com/golang)]

### Libraries / Haxe

*   Haxe: Animation
    *   ğŸ‰ [Actuate (â­159)](https://github.com/jgranick/actuate) - Flexible, fast tween library.
    *   ğŸ‰ [DragonBones (â­43)](https://github.com/openfl/dragonbones) - Runtime support for *DragonBones* skeletal animation.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Spine-Hx (â­56)](https://github.com/jeremyfa/spine-hx) - *Spine* runtime for Haxe.
*   Haxe: Game Engine w/Editor
    *   ğŸ‰ [Armory (â­3.2k)](https://github.com/armory3d/armory) - 3D game engine with full *Blender* integration.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Away3D (â­214)](https://github.com/openfl/away3d) - Real-time 3D engine for OpenFL. \[[Website](http://away3d.com)]
    *   ğŸ‰ [Flixel-Studio (â­105)](https://github.com/Dovyski/flixel-studio) - Embeddable, in-game editor for *HaxeFlixel*.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Hide (â­588)](https://github.com/heapsio/hide) - Extensible IDE for the *Heaps* 3D graphic engine.
    *   ğŸ‰ [LDtk (â­3.7k)](https://github.com/deepnight/ldtk) ğŸ”¥ - Modern, lightweight and efficient 2D level editor. \[[Website](https://ldtk.io)]
    *   ğŸ‰ [Starling (â­247)](https://github.com/openfl/starling) - Popular (*Angry Birds*) 2D game engine built on *OpenFL*. \[[Editor](http://starlingbuilder.github.io) | [Website](https://gamua.com/starling/)]

### Libraries / Java

*   ğŸ“š [OpenGL & GLSL Tutorials (â­1.9k)](https://github.com/mattdesl/lwjgl-basics/wiki) - OpenGL / GLSL tutorials for *LWJGL* and *libGDX*.

### Libraries / JavaScript

*   JavaScript: Animation
    *   ğŸ‰ [Animate.css (â­82k)](https://github.com/animate-css/animate.css) - Ready-to-use, pure CSS animations. \[[Examples](https://animate.style/)]
    *   ğŸ‰ [D3.js (â­111k)](https://github.com/d3/d3) - Data-Driven Documents. Bring data to life with SVG, canvas and HTML. \[[Examples](https://observablehq.com/@d3/gallery) | [Website](https://d3js.org)]
    *   ğŸ’¸ [GreenSock (â­22k)](https://github.com/greensock/GSAP) - Robust animation toolset. \[[Website](https://greensock.com)]
    *   ğŸ‰ [Ossos (â­451)](https://github.com/sketchpunklabs/ossos) - Web-based character animation system.
    *   ğŸ‰ [React-Spring (â­29k)](https://github.com/pmndrs/react-spring) - Spring physics based React animation library.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Scene.js (â­2.8k)](https://github.com/daybrush/scenejs) - JavaScript & CSS timeline-based animation library.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Theatre (â­12k)](https://github.com/theatre-js/theatre) - Motion design editor for the web.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Tween.js (â­10k)](https://github.com/tweenjs/tween.js) - Tweening engine for easy animations using Robert Penner's equations.
    *   ğŸ‰ [TweenJS (â­3.6k)](https://github.com/CreateJS/TweenJS) - Tweening / animation library, part of the *CreateJS* suite.
*   JavaScript: Game Engine w/Editor
    *   ğŸ‰ [A-Frame (â­17k)](https://github.com/aframevr/aframe/) - Web framework for building VR experiences. \[[Website](https://aframe.io)]
    *   ğŸ‰ [Cocos Creator (â­8.8k)](https://github.com/cocos-creator/engine) - Cross-Platform 2D/3D game creation. \[[Website](https://www.cocos.com/en/creator)]
    *   ğŸ‰ [ct.js (â­164)](https://github.com/ct-js/ct-js) - Desktop 2D game engine, built on *PixiJS*.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Egret (â­4k)](https://github.com/egret-labs/egret-core) - Mobile game engine. \[[Editor (â­151)](https://github.com/egret-labs/egret-ui-editor-opensource)]
    *   ğŸ‰ [GDevelop (â­15k)](https://github.com/4ian/GDevelop) - Full-featured 2D game development. \[[Website](https://gdevelop.io/)]
    *   ğŸ‰ [Impact (â­2.1k)](https://github.com/phoboslab/impact) - Game engine for desktop and mobile browsers. \[[2D Level Editor](https://impactjs.com/documentation/weltmeister)]
    *   ğŸ‰ [Isogenic (â­550)](https://github.com/irrelon/ige) - Engine with advanced multiplayer, based on *Valve*'s multiplayer system.
    *   ğŸ‰ [melonJS (â­6.1k)](https://github.com/melonjs/melonJS) - Modern 2D game engine, level editing with [Tiled](https://doc.mapeditor.org/en/stable/). \[[Examples](https://melonjs.github.io/examples/) | [Website](https://melonjs.org)]
    *   ğŸ‰ [microStudio (â­1.1k)](https://github.com/pmgl/microstudio/) - Online game engine. Learn and practice programming.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Pixelbox.js (â­477)](https://github.com/cstoquer/pixelbox) - Sandbox to fast-prototype 2D tile-based games. \[[Download](https://pixwlk.itch.io/pixelbox)]
    *   ğŸ‰ [QICI Engine (â­886)](https://github.com/qiciengine/qiciengine) - Toolset for making games.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Superpowers](https://github.com/superpowers) - Both 2D & 3D game making for indies. \[[Website](http://superpowers-html5.com/index.en.html)]
    *   ğŸ‰ [Taro (â­288)](https://github.com/moddio/taro) - Multiplayer engine with *Box2D* physics, aka *Moddio*. \[[Website](https://www.modd.io)]

### Libraries / Kotlin

*   Kotlin: Game Framework
    *   ğŸ‰ [FXGL (â­4.6k)](https://github.com/AlmasB/FXGL) - Game library for 2D, experimental 3D.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Kool (â­396)](https://github.com/fabmax/kool) - Multi-platform 3D Vulkan / OpenGL graphics engine. \[[Examples](https://fabmax.github.io/kool/kool-js/)]
    *   ğŸ‰ [KTX (â­1.4k)](https://github.com/libktx/ktx) - Kotlin extensions for the *libGDX* game framework.

### Libraries / Rust

*   Rust: Game Framework
    *   ğŸ‰ [Ambient (â­3.9k)](https://github.com/AmbientRun/Ambient) - Multiplayer game engine.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Amethyst (â­8k)](https://github.com/amethyst/amethyst) - Data-driven 2D/3D game engine aiming to be fast and configurable.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Bevy (â­40k)](https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy) ğŸ”¥ - Refreshingly simple data-driven 2D/3D game engine. \[[Website](https://bevyengine.org)]
    *   ğŸ‰ [Macroquad (â­3.9k)](https://github.com/not-fl3/macroquad) - Easy to use game library, heavily inspired by *RayLib*.

### Specialty Topics / Geometry

*   Meshes
    *   ğŸ“š [Geometry, Surfaces, Curves, Polyhedra](https://paulbourke.net/geometry/) - Geometry topics including meshes, shapes, textures and more.
    *   ğŸ“š [Mesh Transforms](https://ciechanow.ski/mesh-transforms/) - *Apple*'s private API for manipulation of UIView meshes. \[[Source (â­4)](https://github.com/olegtyshcneko/CAMeshTransform)]

### Specialty Topics / Network

*   ğŸ“š [Source Multiplayer Networking](https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Source_Multiplayer_Networking) - *Valve*'s Source Engine multiplayer system.

### Specialty Topics / Particles

*   ğŸ“š [Particles](https://learnopengl.com/In-Practice/2D-Game/Particles) - Article by *LearnOpenGL*.

### Specialty Topics / Physics

*   Ropes / Chains
    *   ğŸ“š [Draw SVG rope using JavaScript](https://muffinman.io/blog/draw-svg-rope-using-javascript/) - SVG path vector rope drawing.
    *   ğŸ“š [Ropes in Contraption Maker](https://www.gamedeveloper.com/design/ropes-in-contraption-maker) - Implementing the physics of ropes in *Contraption Maker*.
    *   ğŸŒ [Matter.js: Chains](https://brm.io/matter-js/demo/#chains) - Chains demo using *Matter.js*. \[[Source (â­18k)](https://github.com/liabru/matter-js/blob/master/examples/chains.js)]
*   Soft Body
    *   ğŸ“š [Blob Physics](https://cowboyprogramming.com/2007/01/05/blob-physics/) - Using verlet physics to simulate 2D blobs.
    *   ğŸŒ [Oryol: Bullet Cloth](https://floooh.github.io/oryol-samples/wasm/BulletPhysicsCloth.html) - *Bullet 3D* physics cloth using the *Oryol* game framework. \[[Source (â­82)](https://github.com/floooh/oryol-samples/blob/master/src/BulletPhysicsCloth/BulletPhysicsCloth.cc)]
    *   ğŸŒ [Three.js: Ammo Volume](https://threejs.org/examples/?q=physics#physics_ammo_volume) - 3D soft body volumes using *Ammo.js* and *Three.js*. \[[Source (â­108k)](https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js/blob/master/examples/physics_ammo_volume.html)]

### Specialty Topics / Shaders

*   Noise
    *   ğŸ“š [Book of Shaders: Noise](https://thebookofshaders.com/11/) - Excellent GLSL noise article by Book of Shaders.
    *   ğŸ“š [Color Banding](https://shader-tutorial.dev/advanced/color-banding-dithering/) - Using noise / dithering to improve drawing gradients.
    *   ğŸ‰ [Psrdnoise (â­291)](https://github.com/stegu/psrdnoise/) - Tiling simplex flow noise in 2D/3D.
    *   ğŸ“š [Understanding Perlin Noise](http://adrianb.io/2014/08/09/perlinnoise.html) - Analysis of Perlin Noise, written in C#. \[[Source](https://gist.github.com/Flafla2/f0260a861be0ebdeef76)]
    *   ğŸ‰ [WebGL Noise (â­543)](https://github.com/stegu/webgl-noise/) - Maintained branch of the original *Ashima Arts* 2D, 3D and 4D noise functions.
*   Pixelation
    *   ğŸ“š [Pixel Art Shaders](https://alaingalvan.tumblr.com/post/79829067408/glsl-pixel-art-shaders) - Useful GLSL postprocessing shaders for pixel art games.
    *   ğŸŒ [Three.js: Pixelation Example](https://threejs.org/examples/?q=pixel#webgl_postprocessing_pixel) - WebGL pixelation postprocessing using *Three.js*. \[[Source (â­108k)](https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js/blob/master/examples/webgl_postprocessing_pixel.html)]
*   Water / Refraction
    *   ğŸ“š [2D Water Shader](https://rotatingcanvas.com/fragment-shader-to-simulate-water-surface-in-libgdx/) - GLSL fragment shader to simulate 2D water surface in *libGDX*.

### Specialty Topics / Transparency

*   ğŸ“š [Intro to Order-Independent Transparency](https://learnopengl.com/Guest-Articles/2020/OIT/Introduction) - Article by *LearnOpenGL*.

### Tools / Software / Level Editors

*   ğŸ†“ [TrenchBroom](https://trenchbroom.github.io) - Level editor for *Quake-Engine* games. \[[Source (â­2.3k)](https://github.com/TrenchBroom/TrenchBroom)]

### Tools / Software / Materials / Textures

*   ğŸ†“ [TexTools for Blender](http://www.renderhjs.net/?doc=texToolsBlender) - UV and texturing tools for *Blender*. \[[Source](https://bitbucket.org/renderhjs/textools-blender/src/master/)]

### Tools / Software / Voxel

*   ğŸ‰ [IsoVoxel (â­352)](https://github.com/tommyettinger/IsoVoxel) - Generates isometric pixel art from *MagicaVoxel* .vox files.

### Video Game Assets / Graphic Assets

*   ğŸ†“ [Top Free Game Assets](https://itch.io/game-assets/free) - Top free game assets listed on *itch.io*.

### Video Game Assets / Model Assets

*   ğŸ“š [Retro3DGraphicsCollection (â­1.7k)](https://github.com/Miziziziz/Retro3DGraphicsCollection) - No attribution, retro (*PS1* style) 3D graphics assets.
items.content_html:
Game Engines / Commercial

  • ğŸ’¸ PlayCanvas - Popular (Flappy Bird) WebGL game engine. [Awesome (â­301) | GitHub (â­10k)]

Game Engines / Specialty

  • ğŸ’¸ DopeFish - Doom / Heretic map loading system for GameMaker.

Learning / Computer Graphics

  • Graphics API: Mantle
    • ğŸ“š Mantle - Developed by AMD as an alternative to Direct3D and OpenGL.
  • Graphics API: Metal
    • ğŸŒ Metal - API for developing 3D apps on Apple platforms. [Samples]
    • ğŸ“š Metal Tutorial - Learn how to get started with Metal at RayWenderlich.com.
  • Graphics API: WebGPU
    • ğŸŒ Dawn - Open source, cross-platform implementation of the WebGPU standard, by Google.
    • ğŸŒ WebGPU (â­5.1k) - Next generation web 3D graphics API. [GitHub (â­5.1k)]
    • ğŸŒ WebGPU Demos - Collection of simple WebGPU examples by Apple.

Libraries / C

  • C: Graphics - 3D
    • ğŸ‰ Sokol Gfx (â­8.4k) - Cross-platform, single-file graphics. [Examples]
    • ğŸ‰ Sokol Graphics Painter (â­517) - 2D graphics painter implemented with Sokol.
  • C: Input
    • ğŸ‰ libGamepad (â­24) - Cross-platform library for gamepad input.
    • ğŸ‰ Sokol Gamepad (â­8.4k) - Branch with addon support for gamepads in Sokol.
  • C: Math
    • ğŸ‰ Cglm (â­2.6k) - Highly optimized OpenGL math.
    • â­ Handmade Math (â­1.4k) ğŸ”¥ - Simple, public domain math library for games and computer graphics.
    • ğŸ‰ Kazmath (â­531) - Math library targeted at games.
    • ğŸ‰ Raymath (â­27k) - Math library included in the RayLib game framework.

Libraries / C++

  • C++: File System
    • ğŸ‰ Imgui-Filebrowser (â­755) - Header-only file browser implementation for Dear ImGui in C++17.
  • C++: Game Engine w/Editor
    • ğŸ‰ AnKi 3D Engine (â­1.5k) - Vulkan backend, modern renderer, scripting, physics and more.
    • ğŸ”’ Crown Engine (â­2.2k) - Data-driven 3D and 2D game engine.
    • ğŸ‰ Crystal Engine (â­190) - Vulkan backend with PBR and styled GUI (CrystalWidgets).
    • ğŸ‰ Drop Creator (â­7) - No code, 2.5D game engine built with Qt, OpenGL and Chipmunk Physics.
    • ğŸ”’ Enigma (â­357) - GameMaker compatible 2D engine.
    • ğŸ‰ Esoterica Engine (â­984) - High-performance game engine with editor and AAA quality animation graph.
    • ğŸ‰ Ethereal Engine (â­711) - Cross-platform game engine and editor.
    • ğŸ‰ ezEngine (â­1.7k) - Game engine in active development.
    • ğŸ‰ FIFE (â­565) - Multi-platform isometric game engine.
    • ğŸ‰ Irrlicht - Cross-platform 3D engine worked on for nearly 2 decades. [Website]
    • ğŸ‰ Limon Engine (â­654) - 3D FPS game engine with full dynamic lighting and shadows.
    • ğŸ‰ Lina Engine (â­867) - Modular game engine, aimed to develop 3D desktop games.
    • ğŸ‰ Lumos (â­1.4k) - Cross-platform 2D/3D game engine, supports both OpenGL and Vulkan.
    • ğŸ‰ Lumix Engine (â­3.6k) - A 3D game engine with Dear ImGui based editor.
    • ğŸ‰ MxEngine (â­1.2k) - Modern-C++ general-purpose 3D game engine.
    • ğŸ”’ neoGFX (â­560) - Cross-platform app and game engine.
    • ğŸ‰ Ã–bEngine (â­840) - 2D engine with Lua scripting built with SFML.
    • ğŸ‰ Overload (â­2.3k) - Well documented 3D game engine inspired by industry standards.
    • ğŸ‰ Razix Engine (â­492) - High-performance research engine for production pipeline.
    • ğŸ‰ Rootex (â­225) - Advanced C++ 3D game engine powering an in-production game.
    • ğŸ‰ Skylicht (â­730) - Upgraded features including audio, physics and particles. Built on Irrlicht.
    • ğŸ‰ Spartan Engine (â­2.5k) - Emphasis on quality and performance.
    • ğŸ‰ Torque 3D (â­3.4k) - High-performance 3D engine built on The Forge.
    • ğŸ”’ UPBGE (â­1.6k) - Blender game engine, originally forked from Blender.
  • C++: Graphics - 2D
    • ğŸ‰ Blend2D (â­1.8k) - High-performance 2D vector graphics engine. [Website]
    • ğŸ‰ C++ Bitmap Library (â­175) - Featured bitmap loading and manipulation library.
    • ğŸ‰ QNanoPainter (â­422) - OpenGL accelerated vector drawing library for Qt, powered by NanoVG.
    • ğŸ‰ Skia (â­9.9k) - Complete 2D graphics library used in Chrome by Google. [Website]
    • ğŸ‰ vg-renderer (â­576) - 2D vector graphics renderer for Bgfx, based on ideas from NanoVG.
  • C++: Input
    • ğŸ‰ Gainput (â­875) - Easy to use input library.
    • ğŸ‰ OIS (â­266) - Object-oriented input system. Compatiable with many operating systems.
    • ğŸ‰ Oryol Input (â­2k) - Input module from the Oryol game framework.
  • C++: Libraries
    • ğŸ‰ Boost Libraries - Wide range of C++ libraries, many end up as part of the STL. [Website]
    • ğŸ“š Gamedev Libraries (â­1.6k) - Collection of open source C/C++ libraries for game development.
    • ğŸ“š Inqlude - List of libraries for developers of Qt-based apps.
    • ğŸ“š List of Open Source C++ Libraries - Comprehensive list of open source C++ libraries.
    • ğŸ“š NVIDIA GameWorks - NVIDIA technologies for game & app developers.

Libraries / C#

  • C#: Cross-Platform
    • ğŸŒ Blazor (â­37k) - C# to JavaScript (as WebAssembly) technology by Microsoft. [Website]
    • ğŸ‰ Mono (â­11k) - Open source implementation of Microsoft's .NET Framework.
  • C#: Entity Component System
    • ğŸ‰ Arch (â­1.3k) - High-performance ECS with optional multithreading.
    • ğŸ‰ DefaultEcs (â­707) - ECS framework designed for game development.
    • ğŸ”’ Friflo.Engine.ECS (â­174) - Archetype based ECS with focus on performance, cache locality and DX.
    • ğŸ‰ LeoECS (â­199) - ECS framework powered by C# with optional integration to Unity.
  • C#: Geometry
    • ğŸ‰ DotRecast (â­722) - A port of Recast & Detour, navigation mesh toolset for games, Unity3D, servers, C#.

Libraries / Go

  • ğŸŒ Go - Statically typed, compiled programming language designed at Google. [GitHub]

Libraries / Haxe

  • Haxe: Animation
    • ğŸ‰ Actuate (â­159) - Flexible, fast tween library.
    • ğŸ‰ DragonBones (â­43) - Runtime support for DragonBones skeletal animation.
    • ğŸ‰ Spine-Hx (â­56) - Spine runtime for Haxe.
  • Haxe: Game Engine w/Editor
    • ğŸ‰ Armory (â­3.2k) - 3D game engine with full Blender integration.
    • ğŸ‰ Away3D (â­214) - Real-time 3D engine for OpenFL. [Website]
    • ğŸ‰ Flixel-Studio (â­105) - Embeddable, in-game editor for HaxeFlixel.
    • ğŸ‰ Hide (â­588) - Extensible IDE for the Heaps 3D graphic engine.
    • ğŸ‰ LDtk (â­3.7k) ğŸ”¥ - Modern, lightweight and efficient 2D level editor. [Website]
    • ğŸ‰ Starling (â­247) - Popular (Angry Birds) 2D game engine built on OpenFL. [Editor | Website]

Libraries / Java

  • ğŸ“š OpenGL & GLSL Tutorials (â­1.9k) - OpenGL / GLSL tutorials for LWJGL and libGDX.

Libraries / JavaScript

  • JavaScript: Animation
    • ğŸ‰ Animate.css (â­82k) - Ready-to-use, pure CSS animations. [Examples]
    • ğŸ‰ D3.js (â­111k) - Data-Driven Documents. Bring data to life with SVG, canvas and HTML. [Examples | Website]
    • ğŸ’¸ GreenSock (â­22k) - Robust animation toolset. [Website]
    • ğŸ‰ Ossos (â­451) - Web-based character animation system.
    • ğŸ‰ React-Spring (â­29k) - Spring physics based React animation library.
    • ğŸ‰ Scene.js (â­2.8k) - JavaScript & CSS timeline-based animation library.
    • ğŸ‰ Theatre (â­12k) - Motion design editor for the web.
    • ğŸ‰ Tween.js (â­10k) - Tweening engine for easy animations using Robert Penner's equations.
    • ğŸ‰ TweenJS (â­3.6k) - Tweening / animation library, part of the CreateJS suite.
  • JavaScript: Game Engine w/Editor
    • ğŸ‰ A-Frame (â­17k) - Web framework for building VR experiences. [Website]
    • ğŸ‰ Cocos Creator (â­8.8k) - Cross-Platform 2D/3D game creation. [Website]
    • ğŸ‰ ct.js (â­164) - Desktop 2D game engine, built on PixiJS.
    • ğŸ‰ Egret (â­4k) - Mobile game engine. [Editor (â­151)]
    • ğŸ‰ GDevelop (â­15k) - Full-featured 2D game development. [Website]
    • ğŸ‰ Impact (â­2.1k) - Game engine for desktop and mobile browsers. [2D Level Editor]
    • ğŸ‰ Isogenic (â­550) - Engine with advanced multiplayer, based on Valve's multiplayer system.
    • ğŸ‰ melonJS (â­6.1k) - Modern 2D game engine, level editing with Tiled. [Examples | Website]
    • ğŸ‰ microStudio (â­1.1k) - Online game engine. Learn and practice programming.
    • ğŸ‰ Pixelbox.js (â­477) - Sandbox to fast-prototype 2D tile-based games. [Download]
    • ğŸ‰ QICI Engine (â­886) - Toolset for making games.
    • ğŸ‰ Superpowers - Both 2D & 3D game making for indies. [Website]
    • ğŸ‰ Taro (â­288) - Multiplayer engine with Box2D physics, aka Moddio. [Website]

Libraries / Kotlin

  • Kotlin: Game Framework
    • ğŸ‰ FXGL (â­4.6k) - Game library for 2D, experimental 3D.
    • ğŸ‰ Kool (â­396) - Multi-platform 3D Vulkan / OpenGL graphics engine. [Examples]
    • ğŸ‰ KTX (â­1.4k) - Kotlin extensions for the libGDX game framework.

Libraries / Rust

  • Rust: Game Framework
    • ğŸ‰ Ambient (â­3.9k) - Multiplayer game engine.
    • ğŸ‰ Amethyst (â­8k) - Data-driven 2D/3D game engine aiming to be fast and configurable.
    • ğŸ‰ Bevy (â­40k) ğŸ”¥ - Refreshingly simple data-driven 2D/3D game engine. [Website]
    • ğŸ‰ Macroquad (â­3.9k) - Easy to use game library, heavily inspired by RayLib.

Specialty Topics / Geometry

  • Meshes
    • ğŸ“š Geometry, Surfaces, Curves, Polyhedra - Geometry topics including meshes, shapes, textures and more.
    • ğŸ“š Mesh Transforms - Apple's private API for manipulation of UIView meshes. [Source (â­4)]

Specialty Topics / Network

  • ğŸ“š Source Multiplayer Networking - Valve's Source Engine multiplayer system.

Specialty Topics / Particles

  • ğŸ“š Particles - Article by LearnOpenGL.

Specialty Topics / Physics

  • Ropes / Chains
    • ğŸ“š Draw SVG rope using JavaScript - SVG path vector rope drawing.
    • ğŸ“š Ropes in Contraption Maker - Implementing the physics of ropes in Contraption Maker.
    • ğŸŒ Matter.js: Chains - Chains demo using Matter.js. [Source (â­18k)]
  • Soft Body
    • ğŸ“š Blob Physics - Using verlet physics to simulate 2D blobs.
    • ğŸŒ Oryol: Bullet Cloth - Bullet 3D physics cloth using the Oryol game framework. [Source (â­82)]
    • ğŸŒ Three.js: Ammo Volume - 3D soft body volumes using Ammo.js and Three.js. [Source (â­108k)]

Specialty Topics / Shaders

  • Noise
    • ğŸ“š Book of Shaders: Noise - Excellent GLSL noise article by Book of Shaders.
    • ğŸ“š Color Banding - Using noise / dithering to improve drawing gradients.
    • ğŸ‰ Psrdnoise (â­291) - Tiling simplex flow noise in 2D/3D.
    • ğŸ“š Understanding Perlin Noise - Analysis of Perlin Noise, written in C#. [Source]
    • ğŸ‰ WebGL Noise (â­543) - Maintained branch of the original Ashima Arts 2D, 3D and 4D noise functions.
  • Pixelation
    • ğŸ“š Pixel Art Shaders - Useful GLSL postprocessing shaders for pixel art games.
    • ğŸŒ Three.js: Pixelation Example - WebGL pixelation postprocessing using Three.js. [Source (â­108k)]
  • Water / Refraction
    • ğŸ“š 2D Water Shader - GLSL fragment shader to simulate 2D water surface in libGDX.

Specialty Topics / Transparency

  • ğŸ“š Intro to Order-Independent Transparency - Article by LearnOpenGL.

Tools / Software / Level Editors

  • ğŸ†“ TrenchBroom - Level editor for Quake-Engine games. [Source (â­2.3k)]

Tools / Software / Materials / Textures

  • ğŸ†“ TexTools for Blender - UV and texturing tools for Blender. [Source]

Tools / Software / Voxel

  • ğŸ‰ IsoVoxel (â­352) - Generates isometric pixel art from MagicaVoxel .vox files.

Video Game Assets / Graphic Assets

  • ğŸ†“ Top Free Game Assets - Top free game assets listed on itch.io.

Video Game Assets / Model Assets

  • ğŸ“š Retro3DGraphicsCollection (â­1.7k) - No attribution, retro (PS1 style) 3D graphics assets.

items.title: Awesome Go
items.content_text:
### Networking

*   [natiu-mqtt (â­96)](https://github.com/soypat/natiu-mqtt) - A dead-simple, non-allocating, low level implementation of MQTT well suited for embedded systems.
items.content_html:
Networking

  • natiu-mqtt (â­96) - A dead-simple, non-allocating, low level implementation of MQTT well suited for embedded systems.

items.title: Awesome Data Engineering
items.content_text:
### Testing / Data Profiler

*   [DQOps (â­153)](https://github.com/dqops/dqo) - An open-source data quality platform for the whole data platform lifecycle from profiling new data sources to applying full automation of data quality monitoring.

Testing / Data Profiler

items.title: Awesome Icons
items.content_text:
### Generic

*   [Devicon](https://devicon.dev) - A set of icons representing programming languages, designing & development tools. You can use it as a font or directly copy/paste the svg code into your project.
items.content_html:
Generic

  • Devicon - A set of icons representing programming languages, designing & development tools. You can use it as a font or directly copy/paste the svg code into your project.
